title: How to Make a Splatter Guard from a Sieve

steps.headline: Find your sieve.
steps.description: Check that it fits across the circumference of the pan or pot that you'll be frying the food in. It should be metallic or heatproof.

steps.headline: Fry or cook the food as usual.
Once the food begins to splatter, prepare the sieve guard.
steps.description: Place the sieve face down over the cooking food in the pan or pot.

steps.headline: Check that the handles of both the sieve and the saucepan or pot are facing away from you, toward the back of the stovetop.
steps.description: Rest the sieve handle on the pan's handle.

steps.headline: Leave until the cooking is complete.
steps.description: If you need to remove to stir or turn over the cooking food, take care to remove the pan from the heat first and stand back a bit. Replace when you've shifted the food.

text: Find your sieve. Check that it fits across the circumference of the pan or pot that you'll be frying the food in. It should be metallic or heatproof. Fry or cook the food as usual.  Once the food begins to splatter, prepare the sieve guard. Place the sieve face down over the cooking food in the pan or pot. Check that the handles of both the sieve and the saucepan or pot are facing away from you, toward the back of the stovetop. Rest the sieve handle on the pan's handle. Leave until the cooking is complete. If you need to remove to stir or turn over the cooking food, take care to remove the pan from the heat first and stand back a bit. Replace when you've shifted the food.
